StoryText: My father asks me what I am going to contribute from my paychecks into my retirement fund.
Question: What do I tell him?

OptionText.Text: “I don’t know, I’ll figure it out.”
“Retirement fund? I don’t need that yet.”

OptionResult.Result: My father laughs and tells me we’ll figure it out together and he teaches me about finances.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: I’m glad my father taught me so much about finances and retirement funds because I had no idea! But I might be ready to plan some big time stuff out now!

OptionResult.Result: My father is livid and tells me I absolutely need to start one and tells me I need to look into this. But I’m not going to.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My father is annoyed with me now but I don’t see the big deal. I’m still young and I am keeping more of my money I’m earning so this seems better.

OptionResult.Result: My father gets annoyed at my casual response, he tells me 3% isn’t enough and then teaches me about finances.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: My father got irritated with me, which at first annoyed me too, but he actually did teach me a lot about retirement funds and I think I realized he’s just trying to help. Even when he puts me in a bad mood.

OptionResult.Result: My father is happy with my answer. He decides to take me out for a nice dinner.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: Well, I’m glad I shot for 5% because my father was happy with that and it got me a free dinner! Next time he asks I might say 10% and go for dessert!
